H0.text: It becomes a gas is what happens to some of the water as it is heated to a boil in a pan placed on the stove by a student.

H1.text: It becomes a solid when a student places a pan of water on the stove and heats it to a boil.

H2.text: It gets new atomic bonds as some of the water is heated to a boil when a student places a pan of water on the stove.

H3.text: It gets destroyed as some of the water in a pan that a student places on the stove is heated to a boil.

A4.text: Boiling or ebullition is the rapid phase transition from liquid to gas or vapour; the reverse of boiling is condensation.

A5.text: When a liquid reaches its boiling point bubbles of gas form in it which rise into the surface and burst into the air.
